pygame_utility package¶

Submodules¶

pygame_utility.image_util module¶

pygame_utility.image_util.load_frames(path: str | Path, scale_ratio: Tuple[float, float] = (1.0, 1.0), scale_size: Tuple[float, float] | None = None) → List[Surface][source]¶

Load frames (images) from the given path and return them as a List of pygame Surfaces. The images within directory are loaded in alphabetical order.

Parameters:

  • path (str) – Path of the directory containing image files.

  • scale_ratio (Optional[Tuple[float, float]]) – Tuple representing the scaling ratio for width and height. Takes priority over scale_size if provided.

  • scale_size (Optional[Tuple[float, float]]) – Tuple representing the target width and height in pixels. Used if scale_ratio is None.

Returns:

A List of loaded and scaled frames as pygame Surface objects.

Return type:

List[pygame.Surface]

pygame_utility.image_util.load_image(path: str | Path, scale_ratio: Tuple[float, float] = (1.0, 1.0), scale_size: Tuple[float, float] | None = None) → Surface | None[source]¶

Load an image from the given path and return it as a pygame Surface, scaled by the given ratio or size.

Parameters:

  • path (str) – Path of the image file.

  • scale_ratio (Optional[Tuple[float, float]]) – Tuple representing the scaling ratio for width and height. Takes priority over scale_size if provided.

  • scale_size (Optional[Tuple[float, float]]) – Tuple representing the target width and height in pixels. Used if scale_ratio is None.

Returns:

The loaded and scaled image as a pygame Surface object.

Return type:

pygame.Surface

pygame_utility.image_util.load_state_frames(path: str | Path, scale_ratio: Tuple[float, float] = (1.0, 1.0), scale_size: Tuple[float, float] | None = None) → dict[str, List[Surface]][source]¶

Load multiple frames (images) from subdirectories of the given path and return them as a dictionary of Lists of pygame Surfaces. The images within each subdirectory are loaded in alphabetical order.

Parameters:

  • path (str) – Path of the directory containing subdirectories of image files.

  • scale_ratio (Optional[Tuple[float, float]]) – Tuple representing the scaling ratio for width and height. Takes priority over scale_size if provided.

  • scale_size (Optional[Tuple[float, float]]) – Tuple representing the target width and height in pixels. Used if scale_ratio is None.

Returns:

A dictionary where keys are subdirectory names and values are Lists of loaded and scaled frames as pygame Surface objects.

Return type:

dict[str, List[pygame.Surface]]
